Emergent Travel Health Privacy Policy

Emergent Travel Health Inc. (together with its affiliates, “Emergent Travel Health”) protects the privacy of personally identifiable information that you may provide to us.

Purpose

This Privacy Policy explains what Emergent Travel Health does with personally identifiable information that you provide to us, such as your name, mailing or email address, age or information relating to your medical condition. It also describes how your personally identifiable information will be protected, who we may share it with and for what purposes. This Policy does not apply to information that is provided offline and it only applies to users in the United States where our activities occur.

Registration

Some but not all of our services require registration. This allows us to send you information, provide services to you or contact you about Emergent Travel Health products and services. If you decline to register or to provide all information requested by us, it may not be possible for you to gain access to certain parts of our site or for you to receive all materials, information or services. current.

Collection of Anonymous Computer Information

When you visit our websites, we do not collect any personally identifiable information about you without your permission. However, we do collect anonymous information about you using techniques such as cookies, internet (or action) tags and Graphics Interchange Format (GIFs). This type of anonymous information allows us to evaluate interest in our websites and perform other market research activities, such as surveying browsing habits on our websites. It also allows us to monitor traffic to our websites.

Consent to Provide Your Information to Emergent Travel Health

We request your consent to collect your personally identifiable information when you seek to register for a Emergent Travel Health program or service. In making a request for program or service, we also explain what you are registering to receive and how we plan to use your information. We also offer you the option of discontinuing your consent (“opting out” or “unsubscribing”) if you later decide that you no longer want to participate in that program or receive that service. If we wish to use this information for purposes incompatible from those for which it was initially collected, we will offer a way to opt out of this other use.

Sharing Your Information With Third-Parties

Except as specified in this Privacy Policy, Emergent Travel Health will not share your personally identifiable information with unaffiliated third-parties who are not our business partners for their own separate use unless we have obtained your consent to do so. When you provide personally identifiable information to Emergent Travel Health, it will be accessible to some of our business partners and may be used by those business partners to send commercial email messages to you. Your personally identifiable information may also be shared with third party vendors or service providers who assist us in improving and providing our services. Emergent Travel Health requires business partners and other third-parties to whom we disclose personally identifiable information to protect the information in accordance with applicable law and regulations and not to use it for any use not authorized by us. There may also be instances where Emergent Travel Health may be required to share your personally identifiable information with third-parties who are not our business partners and who have not been retained by us, such as health authorities to report possible adverse drug experiences, during inspections or audits, or pursuant to order of courts or other governmental agencies. Many entities receiving personally identifiable information under these conditions have privacy requirements that apply to their handling of your personally identifiable information. In addition, where you register for and/or participate in one of our text message programs, we may share and combine your telephone number and other personally identifiable information with demographic and other information from third-party service providers in order to improve our services and provide you with information and products that are of interest to you.

Sharing Your Information Within the Emergent Travel Health Group of Companies

The information that you provide to Emergent Travel Health may sometimes be shared among Emergent Travel Health affiliates. This may mean that your personally identifiable information may be transferred outside of the US to Emergent Travel Health affiliates in other countries. All Emergent Travel Health companies that may receive your personally identifiable information will abide by this Privacy Policy and applicable law and regulations.

Security of Your Information

We use appropriate safeguards to protect your personally identifiable information from loss, misuse or alteration. Of course, we cannot guarantee the absolute security of your personally identifiable information. We encourage you to be mindful that internet transmissions are not always secure or error-free and to guard your own computer and password against unauthorized access by others.

Links to Other Sites

This Privacy Policy applies only to this website and not to third party websites. We may provide links to other websites which we believe may be of interest to our visitors but which are not under our control. We cannot guarantee the privacy standards of websites to which we link or be responsible for the contents of websites other than this website. This Privacy Policy does not apply to any linked, non-Emergent Travel Health website.

Transfer of Your Information

When Emergent Travel Health transfers personally identifiable information to countries other than the country where the information was provided, we do so in compliance with applicable privacy laws and regulations. We attempt to protect personally identifiable information entrusted to us no matter what country it is stored in or transferred to and to have appropriate procedures in place to help ensure the security of your personally identifiable information.

Protection of Children

Emergent Travel Health will not knowingly collect, use or disclose personally identifiable information from a minor under the age of 13, without obtaining prior consent from a parent or guardian. Emergent Travel Health abides by the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) in the United States, and respects similar laws and regulations of other countries that protect the privacy of children. Should a child whom we know to be under 13 provide personally identifiable information to us, we will use that information only to respond directly to that child to inform him or her that we must have parental or guardian consent before receiving information about him or her.

Accountability

Our privacy practices are periodically reviewed to verify compliance with this Privacy Policy.

Updating and Accessing Your Information

We encourage you to regularly update the personally identifiable information that you provide to us, such as a new mailing or email address, so that we may most efficiently and accurately provide information or services to you. In addition, Emergent Travel Health complies with laws and regulations applicable to the right to amend your information in our files. All requests to update or access your information will be subject to verification of the identity of the requesting individual so that we may protect your personally identifiable information from unauthorized access or alteration by third parties. To review and request changes to any of your personally identifiable information, please contact our Chief Compliance Officer at the address or email address provided below.

Updated Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy is effective as of July, 2019. Emergent Travel Health may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Notice of material changes to the Privacy Policy will be prominently posted on our website.

“Do Not Track” Signals

Some internet browsers include the ability to transmit “Do Not Track” signals. We do not honor such “Do Not Track” signals.

Third Party Collection

Third parties are allowed to collect personally identifiable information about your online activities over time and across different sites when you use our services.

Your Rights and Choices

We encourage you to regularly update the personal information that you provide to us, such as a new mailing or email address, so that we may most efficiently and accurately provide information or services to you. In addition, depending on where you live, you may be able to request access, correction, deletion, transfer, or objection to further processing of your personal information. Once we receive your request, it will be subject to verification of the identity of the requesting individual so that we may protect your personal information from unauthorized access or alteration by third parties. If you would like to use an authorized agent registered with the California Secretary of State to exercise your rights, we may request evidence that you have provided such agent with power of attorney or that the agent otherwise has valid written authority to exercise rights on your behalf. To submit a request with respect to your personal information, please contact our Chief Compliance Officer at the address or email address provided below or use the form provided below. California residents can also submit requests by calling 855-894-4986.

How to Contact Us

If you have any questions about our Privacy Policy, please email or write to us at:

Legal Department
Emergent Travel Health Inc.
555 Twin Dolphin Drive, Suite 360
Redwood City, CA 94065
Email: privacy@ebsi.com

PERSONAL INFORMATION REQUEST FORM

Please fill out this form if you wish to exercise your right to access, rectify, delete, transfer, or object to further processing of the personal information we may have about you.
